main

Class Endpoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Endpoint

  • public class Endpoint
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class provides endpoint URLs for the Loop API. This API provides a REST backend for Loop app. Handles user and post creation and management as well as messaging between users. This class routes the URLs and handles hold high level view of API.

    This API also manages MYSQL database for generated data.

    All responses and requests are made in JSON.

      • newUser

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response newUser(java.lang.String firstName,
                                         java.lang.String lastName,
                                         java.lang.String latitude,
                                         java.lang.String longitude,
                                         java.lang.String email,
                                         java.lang.String password,
                                         java.lang.String userName,
                                         java.lang.String work)
                                  throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                         java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Allows generation of new users which are added to MySQL database.
        Parameters:
        firstName: - first name of user
        lastName: - last name of user
        latitude: - latitude of user
        longitude: - longitude of user
        email: - email of user
        password: - user password (SHA-256 Hashed and Salted)
        userName: - username
        work: - place of work for user
        Returns:
        JSON output with userID
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException - the instantiation exception
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - the illegal access exception
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - the class not found exception

      • getPost

                                         java.lang.String sortby)
                                  throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                         java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                         java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Gets the post from database.
        Parameters:
        userID: - user id from user that created post
        password: - user password (SHA-256 Hashed and Salted)
        max: - maximum number of returned posts
        sortby: - how posts are to sorted (Location, End Time, Start Time)
        Returns:
        the post
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException - the instantiation exception
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - the illegal access exception
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - the class not found exception
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - the number format exception
